description: From Middle English bestyrien, bestirien, from Old English bestyrian (“to heap up, pile up”), equivalent to be- +‎ stir.

verbs.description: bestir (third-person singular simple present bestirs, present participle bestirring, simple past and past participle bestirred)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To put into brisk or vigorous action; to move with life and vigor.
(reflexive) To make active; to rouse oneself.
